intro: Claytonia dilatata, commonly known as the pink rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, and it produces small, rounded seeds in a capsule. Claytonia dilatata is adapted to harsh conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
